text: The Thomas Walters House, near Hodgenville, Kentucky, was built around 1880. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1991. It is a two-story, five bay house with elements of Italianate style. It was built upon stone piers, has three interior brick chimneys, and has a hipped roof. Up to 1990, the house had not much been altered, besides the addition of modern aluminum siding. With It is located on U.S. Route 31E north of Magnolia. ==References== Category:Historic districts on the National Register of Historic Places in Kentucky Category:National Register of Historic Places in LaRue County, Kentucky Category:Italianate architecture in Kentucky Category:Houses completed in 1880
title: Thomas Walters House
